embeds.title: Overexert

Gain 4 **Potency** :p_potency:.
 **Command** twice.)

messages.content: i think 1 2 combo is good enough to warrant this card being a pickup, but needing a rare for another rare to be good is ehh
AOE command is like 1/3-1/4th buff
so just split specialist and repurpose and *maybe* teamwork beside one two combo
that actually feel significantly stronger because you have minion master

Your mileage will vary based upon several factors. How much potency can you generate, which slimes do you have to benefit from this (leeching probably being the best to make it a block engine), and how many cards with the keyword command do you have in your deck? Getting extra value out of each command can be pretty nice as a form of multiplicative scaling with potency, but that is asking for a lot of moving pieces (somewhat similar to defects orbs). There are definitely going to be decks where this plays a good role to scale you into late game, and it's especially good if you can reliably make strong slimes to benefit from the extra commands, but this is pretty expensive.

As a 2 cost power, there is a pretty real risk to putting it in your deck, though fortunately you can benefit from this right away if you have cheap command cards and 4 energy (Mummified hand will also help get some energy back). As a rare, there is also a significant opportunity cost, since you will have to take this over other rares (or have it drop from a normal combat), or pay a lot of gold at a shop, and I think it's situational enough that you will find yourself taking more consistent rares/buying relics/removing cards much more often. Slime boss is fairly stacked at rare with mass feed, shape of puddle, leech life, ooze bath, and recycling all being pretty strong regardless of what you are doing. 

There are 5 commons with command (4 of them split cards that exhaust themselves), 2 uncommons that reliably command (forward tackle and pile on, split specialist only works once, and needs an upgrade to do so, I believe lead by example triggers once upon playing it), and 3 rares (one two combo and mass repurpose both need to be upgraded). Of those, one two combo+ is probably the best way to trigger this, but needing 2 specific rares, one of them upgraded, to get the synergy going is not going to happen reliably. Largely, this is not going to come together very often, a niche scaling option.

It's pretty bad throughout all of act 1 and 2, since you need to get some multiplicate scaling going with it, and it's expensive and gets in the way during shorter hallway/elite fights. As soon as the act 2 boss, the scaling can become more valuable, and act 3 is usually slow enough to get something like this working. The upgrade is dreadful. I am normally the first person to defend innate upgrades for powers, I think they have their place in the game, and I enjoy having situational upgrades that aren't always correct to go for. The issue here is that I can almost never imagine it being correct to upgrade this, you need to get your potency cards and slime minions down before you play this for it to really shine, and it's extremely bad in hallway fights. This is a card that's much better when you draw it on turn 3/4 and already have some of that multiplicative stuff set up. On top of that, having an upgrade that lowered to cost to 1 would make this more generally takeable, and easier to get in play, which I think is warranted given how awkward it is to pay 2 for an effect this clunky. That would be a welcome buff to the card.

I understand why it's worded the way it is, but it can lead to some non intuitive feel bad interactions. It feels like this should work better with rally the troops and lead by example. It also really hurts minion master that many of the cards that have command on them exhaust, so you may synergize with it well on the first cycle through your deck, but then it does very little later on in the fight.
I think this card is overshadowed by <lead by example>. A much more forgiving condition, cheaper, and of lesser rarity.
